instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1502: What is A1502? A1502 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2014, Late 2013, Early 2015 with EMC 2875, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3476, 820-3536, 820-4924..
definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.P5VS4RS3_EN: What is P5VS4RS3_EN? PP5VS4RS3_EN is a signal that enables the PP5V_S4RS3 power rail. When you see _EN in front of a signal name, it means that it is enabling whatever comes before the _EN when the signal is high..
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .
definitions.PM_SLP_S3_L: What is PM_SLP_S3_L? PM_SLP_S3_L puts the machine to sleep in an S3 state when it is asserted, the _L means it is asserted when it is low voltage. When this signal is 3.3v the machine will be asked to turn on S0 power rails and begin the bootup process.
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.P3V3S0_EN: What is P3V3S0_EN? This signal enables the PP3V3_S0 power rail when it is high. Signals with _EN on the end enable whatever came before the _EN if the signal is high. .
definitions.3V3_S0: What is 3V3_S0? Abbreviation for PP3V3_S0, a 3.3v power rail present when the machine is in an S0 working state.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> .023mA No power. MIssing <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Working on this board with no fan spin.
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>  12.56v
<SIGNAL>PPVRET_G3H</SIGNAL> 3.3V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> 5V
<SIGNAL>PP3V_S5</SIGNAL> 3.3V
<SIGNAL>P5VS4RS3_EN</SIGNAL> is 0v. Pm_
<SIGNAL>SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> jumps to 1.4v when plugged in then  drops to 0v.

Has some signs of cleaning done but no corrosion visible.
Tried Smc bypass, fan spins a few times and current drops to ..019ma before returning to .023ma.
Checked Cpu coils and no voltage present when plugged in and no short to gnd on coils.
No noticeable shorts on the other coils.
Any input appreciated.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> .023mA No power. MIssing <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
If <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> pulse high, S3 voltages should pulse too.
Also check the same for <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S3_L</SIGNAL> and S0 voltages.
<SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> pulses too?

Better to (repeatedly) triger <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> when check mentioned signals; use <RESISTOR>R5115</RESISTOR>/16 pads, instead of power button.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> .023mA No power. MIssing <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Hi <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S3L</SIGNAL> pulses also. All S0 voltages pulse but <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> has 1.9v present constantly pulsing slightly higher all the rest drop to 0v. <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> pulses also.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> .023mA No power. MIssing <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
CPU coils pulsing too?
Also check pins 7 & 3 of <CHIP>U1950</CHIP>.
Did you try BIOS?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> .023mA No power. MIssing <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Cpu coils not pulsing, havent changed the bios yet. Just curious as to why I would be gettting 1.9v on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL>  when no <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> or any s4 voltages?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> .023mA No power. MIssing <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
When <CHIP>U8030</CHIP> is removed I get
<SIGNAL>P3V3S0_EN</SIGNAL> jumps to 3.3v and I get
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> 3.3v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> .5V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> 5V

Problem seems to be with the .5v on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0_FET</SIGNAL> line.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> .023mA No power. MIssing <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> .023mA No power. MIssing <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> .023mA No power. MIssing <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
When I fit a new one I loose <SIGNAL>P3V3S0_EN</SIGNAL> signal and get .5v on pins 1 and 3.

Fit another <CHIP>U8030</CHIP> now getting .094ma <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0_FET</SIGNAL>. but still no fan spin

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> .023mA No power. MIssing <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Then you have problem with something connected to <SIGNAL>3V3_S0</SIGNAL> power rail.
What is diode mode reading there?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> .023mA No power. MIssing <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message: it reads 0.37 good board reads 0.10. its dropped back to .023ma with <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0_FET</SIGNAL> back to 1.9v so maybe damaged new <CHIP>U8030</CHIP>
